channel.title: RSC status page
channel.description:
I have created a place where you can advertise your very own or your most wanted RSC server. This site is based on MoparScape Status checker. It is his own script code and of course 90% credits goes to Moparisthebest. on time I hope that page will make money, I also would like to expand that page to other kind servers. But now you're free to add your very own RSC server and see it grow on my RSC server status page.
Well since you have read everything I think you are want to see the page at its current stage. http://goo.gl/RPI8n
Please note that as it is now you have to register a account to be able to Post/vote and add a new server, that might change in time.
Thank you MoparIsTheBest and myself for editing and making this possible. Before I forget some links and pictures may not work but in less than 24 hours they will.

item.title: RSC status page
item.dc:creator: @mapu mapu
item.description:
@mapu wrote:

I remember hosting an RSC status page on 3hit, the good old days.

Read full topic

item.title: RSC status page
item.dc:creator: @famouze famouze
item.description:
@famouze wrote:

Which errors do you mean I thought i went through is all.
I haven’t had the time to work at it at all today!

Been fixing some stuff its always alot work when you do these kind of stuff, but your infomation I’m taking the BBCode images directly from www.moparisthebest.com, might change it intime.
Anyhow I have some trouble making the online/offline image work, if you can tell me anything about that i would be glad.

When its all ready i will start on a new layout.

Read full topic

item.title: RSC status page
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

You still have some errors and various pictures not showing up, also, you need to post a link to the full source code as you are currently running it to comply with the AGPL license of the code:

github.com

moparisthebest/Server-Status-Page/blob/master/LICENSE

to take away your freedom to share and change the works.  By contrast,
our General Public Licenses are intended to guarantee your freedom to
share and change all versions of a program--to make sure it remains free
software for all its users.

  When we speak of free software, we are referring to freedom, not
This file has been truncated. show original

Good to see other people using this though.

Read full topic
